Recomendo esse jogo tanto para jogar em party com amigos quanto jogar sozinho como Killer. Em calls com minhas amigas a gente se diverte muito chegando a gritar no microfone de susto quanto aparece o Freddy Krueger ou o Pânico em cima da gente quando estamos fazendo gerador, extremamente viciante e tem uma rejogabilidade imensa, vários personagens, skins em que você pode desbloquear apenas jogando, possui sistema de cash mas sinceramente acho que só vale a pena no caso das DLCs se tiver de promoção. (Comprei o Legião por 8 reais e valeu muito a pena), se caso você não tem amigos pra jogar junto ainda vale a pena sendo Killer em que você caça outros players e persegue o quão retardado você é por ser bloqueado por uma barricada ÓBVIA no mapa ou ver um cara agachado jurando que tá escondido. 
Mas em geral, com amigos o jogo é muito melhor, chegou a ser rotina entre meu grupo de amigas no final do dia jogar 3 partidinhas e conversar sobre o dia. 
Recomendo, acho caro o preço padrão, mas vale a pena se você gostar de jogos tipo MOBA.

Soooo erstmal vorweg gesagt:

1. Ich bin Killer-Main, zocke aber auch sehr viel Survivor
2. Die Bewertung bezieht sich nicht auf diesen Patch, denn sonst wäre der Daumen unter dem Erdkern
3. Behavior fix this shit!

Also:
DbD ist das Game mit dem ich nach League of Legends in meinem Leben wohl am meisten Zeit verbracht habe. Und die Communtiy ist stellenweise schlimmer als die von LoL, also wenn ihr League kennt und wegen der Community nicht abkönnt... ähm... Finger weg sonst Aua!
DbD ist ein Spiel in dem man problemlos als, ich zitiere an dieser Stelle, "Nazikind" beleidigt werden kann, ohne dass der Support bei doppelter Einsendung auf Englisch auch nur mit den Achseln zuckt. Gibt auch tolle Leute dort, hab eine Ex von mir da kennengelernt (okay die war jetzt nich soo toll), aber auch meine bis heute besten Freundinnen (Tinder 2.0, glaubt mir klappt hier besser).

Gameplaytechnisch ist es je nach Patch ein absolut anderes Erlebnis. Mal schlägt man mit den Killern durch Survivor durch, während Survivor in ihrer Perspektive von der Huntress und dem Slinger um die Ecke getroffen werden, mal is alles ganz gut soweit, je nach Serverdedication und Hitboxverteilung halt (vorsicht an der Stelle, meistens ist tatsächlich die Dedication schuld und nicht die Hitbox). 

Entwicklungstechnisch über die Jahre hat sich in Dead by Daylight aber auch sehr gutes getan. Wenn ein Killer komplett OP oder UP war, wurde sich dem grundsätzlich angenommen, wenn auch in eigener Geschwindigkeit... wenn ein Item oder ein Offering broken war wurde es gener... moment Keys existieren immernoch, ich nehme das mal zurück an der Stelle. Aber Moris mussten ja sterben, danke dafür Behavior. Nostalgisch aus den alten Tagen gibt es eigentlich nur noch das Glockengeräusch des Wraiths. Den meisten restlichen Boomershit wechselt Behavior öfters als Kaffeetassen der Mitarbeiter gespühlt werden, damit ja keine starke Bindung zu gewohnten Dingen aufgebaut werden kann. Aber Dinge wandeln sich nun mal, man sollte aber vielleicht nicht Dinge ändern über die sich niemand beschwert hat *hust GUI hust*.

Fazit:
Sorry für den ganzen bissigen Sarkasmus, denn versteht mich nicht falsch! Dead by Daylight ist ein geniales Spiel. Die DLCs sind zum größten Teil ihren Preis absolut wert und Behavior gibt dir sogar die Möglichkeit nichtlizensierte Charaktere mit Fortschritt freizuspielen, was eigentlich selbstverständlich sein sollte aber heutzutage nun mal nicht mehr so ist. Ich habe in dieses Spiel nicht umsonst über 1000 Stunden gesteckt und spiele es immer noch mit wechselnder Stimmung dabei. Behavior macht vieles falsch, man darf aber nicht vergessen, dass sie wenigstens noch ein Entwicklerstudio sind, das nicht irgendeinem Indieentwicklerfleischwolfkonzern gehört und deshalb ist es irgendwie noch unterstützenswert. Von mir gibt es eine Kaufempfehlung für Menschen mit starken Nerven gegenüber harter Toxicness und guter Geduld gegen Entwickler.
Danke fürs durchlesen.

The games lost its touch for me. ive played it for a few years on computer and ps4. where if your a survivor you can either get a baby killer or someone that only uses the best perks and add ons and sweats the whole game. on the killer side either you get baby survivors or you only get swfs that all think they are the next big thing for the game. 

if you want to play the game as a causal experience play survivor. its easier to play and honestly you dont feel like the game is punching you in the balls to play.

If you play killer and have any intention of playing the game for fun be prepared for a grind and for you to feel like this game hates you. every game will begin with chases that you will lose multiple gens and feel like you cant do anything about it. 

at the begining of play killer if you have some idea what your doing the game can go either way. you can see what you do wrong and what you do right. you can have fun but when you get into red ranks be prepared for every survivor to be having barrowed time. DS, sprint burst, flashlights, and most likely iron will, and dead hard. If you do anything wrong most survivors will open the exit gates and teabag you waiting for you to come. they will hold the game hostage just so they can rub it in your face. the game will feel very one sided. specially when you have a group of four swfs that all communicate and say what your doing and such. but i cant blame them. its a advantage. why not use it right.

As survivor at the beginning you think you can do well against most killers that are low ranks. which is fun in its own rights. when you get to higher ranks be prepared to go against mostly bubbas, nurses, hags, and myers. each one either has a really efficently gets rid of loops or and one shot all survivors. 

even when play either side i can say that playing as a survivor feels better than playing killer. you have alot more options to do things against the killer. you can really make a killer feel helpless and make the game not fun for them. If i had a say in all this the game needs some serious balancing. if you wanted it to feel like the killers have want to punch themselves in the face over and over again to play your game then you got it on the mark.

They say its a scary or horror game but it really isnt. its a cat and mouse game. the story is cool but the gameplay isnt for the horror title. if you like dota or league of legends you might get a real kick out of the game. it isnt for the casual gamer.

I have spent a lot of time on this game, as you can tell by my hours, and I have had a blast up until one of their most recent updates that I am sure everyone knows about... though they have fixed this, the ranking system is now all messed up.  Killers that should be very low rank are now at red and purple ranks (top tier ranks) and play very cheaply in order to stay at said rank, and these ways are next to impossible to have fun against, nevermind win against.  If it was early 2020, I'd say buy this game, but the way it is now, it will only make you mad and frustrated...

every update, all they do is break the game more. it's honestly not even worth playing anymore. for how old this game is, and for how frequently it is "updated" it should NOT have these issues. it is clear the devs and balance team dont really care about the players' experience. they just want a paycheck and to go home. hitboxes have always been broken, so many "visual bugs." if it were just one or two guys working on this game, that would be different. but even tiny little indie games with less than 5 devs have less issues than behavior. the dev team is honestly a joke. they took an amazing game idea and experience and constantly crap all over it. the fanbase could put out a better version of this game than the dev's themselves and id play that over this any day.

It is a really fun game. It really is, don't get me wrong. But damn, they need to get their shit together. I have had 5 hard crashes in the 6,4 hours I have spent with the game. At this point I have probably spent just as much time trying to fix the damn thing as I've actually gotten to play it. But when the game works It's a really fun time, especially when playing with a group of friends where you can take turns playing as the killer.
i dont even know this game

Let me start by saying I came from console to PC so I have a lot more hours in the game than I do on Steam, this is also my first ever review of a game.
DBD has been going downhill for a long time now with unbalanced perks/killers, unpolished gameplay, poor map design choices, and in general not listening to the things the community truly wants from the game. 
Even coming to the point of them releasing an update changing the UI and survivor animations when most people said it looked and felt horrible.
Quite frankly I can't just blame the devs because the community has also built up this aggressive toxicity and through that has caused the fun value to decline.
Maybe the devs can bring it back, but I'm not holding my breath.

Hackers galore everywhere. Too much toxicity on both sides, even worse than other online games. At least those games give you a chance to fight back on equal footing. Tunneling and camping killers. Terrible teammates. Bully squads. Gens getting done way too fast. The same meta perks always used by sweats and because the devs would rather use a band aid on a giant wound that is the game mechanics instead of actually fixing it. And a SKILL based mmr that doesn't reward player skill and actions, but only if they survived or got kills. You can literally just hide in the corner the entire game, let everyone die, and go through hatch to be rewarded more than the team player. Alternatively, as killer, you can just tunnel and camp everyone and rank up more than a killer that got 12 hooks through chases and guarding gens. Now more killers are just anti-loop, so just press w now. Boons, there's no limit to them now and are a handicap on killers. Either waste valuable time stepping on one for it to be relit or just suck it up. Not to mention, no real competition for these types of games. So the devs can ignore all of this stuff and just pump out more cosmetics and rehashed killers. If you really care about the health of this game, pick up one of its competitors so that the devs at least have to try.

Let me get out of the way, my pc is not a powerhouse. I got it when GTA V was the height of graphics, i do NOT have the money to be buying a console or a new pc or components. But before the last update i could play dbd okay enough on lowest graphic settings. No stuttering unless too many particles (like fire effects) were right in front of player view.

But ever since the last update its run like shit, stuttering every step, making killer infuriating and survivor impossible. This isn't even bringing up the Other effects of the update which made the game even worse.

Do yourself a favor and just buy gmod and play slasher or slender with chat muted and youll have a more pleasant experience

Dead by Daylight is one of those frustrating games that falls into the category of super replayable, fun and entertaining whilst also being terribly rage-inducing, frustrating and sometimes you feel like you can't win regardless of what you do. But for the most part, I'd say that I'd def recommend it to play and have it be like it is for me: my favorite game that I hate and love to play.
